intents.answer: Students must submit mark sheets, transfer certificate, ID proof, passport-size photographs, and application form. For SC/ST students, caste certificate is required. Additional documents may include migration certificate.
questions: What documents are required for admission?
Which certificates are needed during admission?
Do I need to submit documents for college admission?
What paperwork is required for admission?
Is transfer certificate required for admission?
What documents do I need to bring on admission day?

intents.answer: Applications can be submitted online through the college website or offline at the college office. The process involves filling the online form, submitting required documents, and paying the admission fee. Merit list is declared within 2 weeks of application closure.
questions: How can I apply for admission?
How do I register for college admission?
Can I apply online for admission?
Where do I submit the admission form?
How long does the admission process take?

intents.answer: Yes, the campus is under 24/7 CCTV surveillance with trained security personnel stationed at all entry points. We have an emergency response team and security protocols for student safety.
questions: Is the college safe for students?
What are the security measures on campus?

intents.answer: Yes, separate hostel facilities are available for both boys and girls with modern amenities including WiFi, common rooms, laundry, 24/7 water supply, and security guards. Each room has a study table and attached bathroom.
questions: Are there separate hostels for boys and girls?
Can students stay in college hostel?

intents.answer: Undergraduate courses cost Rs. 2,50,000 per year, postgraduate courses cost Rs. 5,00,000 per year. B.Sc programs are Rs. 1,50,000 per year. Hostel fees range from Rs. 50,000 to Rs. 75,000 per year. Scholarship options are available for deserving students.
questions: How much are the college fees?
How much does UG and PG cost?
Is there a fee waiver or concession?

intents.answer: Yes, students can access attendance, results, notices, and fees through the online portal. The portal is accessible 24/7 with a unique login ID and password provided during admission.
questions: Is there an online student portal?
Where can I check attendance and results?
Does the college have a student login?
How do I view notices online?
Is there a digital portal for students?
How do I reset my portal password?

intents.answer: Yes, remedial classes are conducted for students who need additional academic support. These are held twice a week and focus on fundamentals and problem-solving techniques.
questions: Do you provide extra classes for weak students?

intents.answer: Placements are arranged for final-year students through the Training and Placement Department. Companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Google, and Amazon visit the campus. Average package is 8 LPA with highest being 25 LPA. Placement rate is over 95%.
questions: Does the college provide job placements?
What is the average placement salary?

intents.answer: Yes, internships are arranged for students during their final semesters in collaboration with industries. Summer internships (May-July) and semester internships are available. Partners include Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and various startups.
questions: Does the college help with internships?
Can I do internship during semester?

intents.answer: The library has 50,000+ books, 100+ digital journals, e-books, and online databases including JSTOR, IEEE Xplore, Google Scholar. The library is open 24/7 during semester with a dedicated computer lab and quiet study areas.
questions: What facilities are available in the library?
Are journals available in the library?
Can students access digital library resources?

intents.answer: The college is located in Yelahanka New Town, Bangalore with easy access via public transport. The campus is spread across 25 acres with modern infrastructure. Coordinates: 13.1845°N, 77.5937°E. Main entrance is on Jala Hobli Road.
questions: Is the college near public transport?

intents.answer: Main office: +91-80-6751-2345. Admissions: +91-80-6751-2100. Email: admissions@collegewala.edu. Fax: +91-80-6751-2200. Office hours: 9 AM to 5 PM, Monday to Friday. Emergency contact available 24/7.
questions: What is the college contact number?
How do I reach the admissions office?
What is the college phone number?

intents.answer: State-of-the-art sports facilities include cricket ground, football field, basketball court, badminton courts, tennis court, swimming pool, gym with modern equipment, table tennis area, and indoor sports facility.
questions: Can I play cricket on campus?

intents.answer: B.Tech: 12th pass with PCM (50% aggregate) and valid JEE Main score. MBA: Bachelor's degree with 50% marks and valid CAT/MAT score. MCA: B.Sc/B.Tech with 50% marks. B.Sc: 12th pass with Science stream. Relaxations available for SC/ST students.
questions: Can I apply without JEE Main score?
What is the minimum percentage required?

intents.answer: Merit scholarships: 10-50% tuition waiver. Need-based financial aid available. SC/ST scholarships: 100% tuition waiver. Minority scholarships for eligible students. Sports scholarships for talented athletes. Apply through Financial Aid Office before Dec 31st.
questions: How do I apply for scholarship?

intents.answer: All faculty members hold PhD degrees from top universities. Average teaching experience is 10+ years. Faculty has published research papers in international journals. Student-faculty ratio is 12:1 for personalized attention.
questions: How many PhD holders are on campus?

intents.answer: B.Tech (CSE, ECE, Mechanical, Civil, Electrical - 4 years). MBA (2 years). MCA (3 years). B.Sc (PCM, PCB - 3 years). Diploma programs also available. All programs are NAAC accredited.
